Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, has the "wow" factor”
Reviews.Author: ARTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!!! Rooms are fabulous. We stayed in the levitation with the larger shower thats behind the bed. It was a great vibe and was in a great location. The bus stops pretty much right in front of the hotel. You can navigate from the bus to anywhere in the city. The only disappointment was that we could not check in at 2pm and had to leave our belongings. Then our belongings were put in the wrong room and we had to track them down, which worried me. Then the olfactory channel was gone and was told it was being "worked on" and wasn't given any other explanation. This was disappointing bc I felt it would have been neat to have in the room. However, great hotel. I feel that breakfast was overpriced at 18 euros. There is a fabulous deli/bakery store right around the corner that was much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A so memorable experience !!”
Reviews.Author: F2H
Reviews.Content: I am in Paris for Business every month and I was looking for a very comfortable hotel to relax when not working and I have found a magic place. The Seven has everything I need...Romantic when my wife wants to join me (she should do it more often !), wonderful modern and trendy design, extremely comfortable bed and lovely bathrooms. And a memorable smiling and very professional welcome from the whole team which makes me feel at home. Breakfast is just too good in terms of quality and choice and bar cocktails are magic... I have discovered the Seven once by chance and now my chance will be to go back very regularly. I am always happy to travel to Paris thanks to the Seven ! I am traveling everywhere in the world and Paris is now my favorite destination !

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Voyager5792
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel 7 and had only one regret… leaving it or more precisely leaving the stunning room. We had a booked an absolute levitation room and loved its design and atmosphere. All is there to invite you to relax: big comfy bed (which, remember, does not touch the ground), dim lights and tiny LED’s everywhere (on the ceiling, in the shower and toilets, around the translucide furniture), big flat screen TV…. and for us a bottle of Champagne (included in the price since we benefited from a special offer via www.voyageprive.com). Clouds have been painted on the room ceiling and when you are lying on the bed at night with only the tiny LED’s on you do have the impression to look at the sky… just amazing! A word for the shower, big enough to accommodate 2 persons with 2 small showers AND a rain-like shower in the middle… again amazing! By the way, we were in room 101. The staff is also very friendly. Various food is offered for breakfast: FRESH fruit juices, muffins, pancakes, croissants, cheese, eggs, sausages, etc. even sweets!!! As for the hotel location, it is just perfect to visit Paris since the rue Mouffetard and Saint-Germain are at a walking distance, plus with the metro nothing is far away in Paris. I would definitely recommend this stunning hotel which deserves its 4*!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful five-night stay at the Seven Hotel Paris and I highly recommend it for travelers interested in a boutique property that is: - Funky - Comfortable - Well-executed - Stunning This is not a traditional hotel and it may not appeal to all tastes. However, it succeeds masterfully in its attempt to provide an eclectic, distinctive, and memorable stay in Paris. I'll confess that the same sense of curiosity that initially drew me to the Seven also led me to room-hop during my stay, because I wanted to sample a few different room styles. I spent time in the Close to the Stars room, the Levitation Bath room, and finally the 007 Suite. In each case, the attention to detail is striking. Each room has a distinct personality and uses, among other things, innovative lighting to deliver the goods. Very little is left to chance; the bath fixtures are premium quality; the bed, linens, and bath products are excellent; and the window treatments are stylish, elegant, and effective, blocking nearly all daylight from intruding on the light show inside. Note, please, fellow travelers, that this is a boutique hotel. In Paris. If you are new to either setting, you might be taken off guard by the relatively small size of the rooms, the lobby, the bar, etc. Do not despair. This is absolutely typical of both this hotel type and the city itself. If you want a larger room or a full-service property with a fitness center or other amenities, then select a property that will accommodate those needs. But by all means, do not knock the Seven for what it is not, when what it IS is so wonderful. A large part of what makes it so great is the execution. Great service, a personable and pleasant staff, and impeccable attention paid to delivering an enjoyable guest experience work together to take a stylish offering, and to give it life and pump its soul full of delightful personality. They didn't miss a beat at any level of client interaction. The surrounding neighborhood is safe and quiet. Basic amenities such as 24-hour grocery stores, cafés, bakeries, restaurants, etc., are all very conveniently located (typical of Paris), and I enjoyed a number of great meals just a short walk away (look into Le Languedoc, L'Hydrophobe, and Le Tourbillon if you wish to follow in my footsteps). However, there is not nearly as much going on at Rue Berthollet as there would be if you were near, say, Rue Saint-Honoré or Rue Saint-Germain. But what the neighborhood may lack in character, Seven Hotel Paris more than makes up for. I can't wait to return and sample some more of these brilliantly-executed rooms and suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: MartinNieri
Reviews.Content: I'd been following Seven Hotel on Facebook for some time and when the opportunity to stay in Paris arose, I was very excited to book a double room at the hotel. Upon arrival at 15:20 we were told that check-in wasn't until 16:00 and that we would have to come back. Having paid €333 a night, I expected to check-in to my room at the universal time of 14:00. Eventually, we were allowed to check-in to our room, which was indeed ready! Our bedroom was very chic in design but very small and the shower leaked. The hotel stairwells are very tight and dark and finding a way past the cleaners and their trolleys can be a challenge although there is a lift to bypass this issue if you are that way inclined! The big issue as far as my wife and I were concerned was the lack of communal space for a hotel that charges such a premium. There is a small bar and a breakfast room in the basement but that is pretty much it - no lounge, no garden and no communal seating areas dotted around the hotel. The breakfast is good, lots of choice but I guess I'd expect that given the price. Overall, it's OK as a boutique hotel but I would say that it is design over substance and pretty much in-practical in layout and the facilities and the location certainly do not warrant the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: erinsny
Reviews.Content: If you're okay with trying something different, the Seven Hotel Paris is a great choice! The funky lighting and "levitating bed" were really unique, and my boyfriend and I just loved our room. The hotel is located just outside the Latin Quarter and is still close to just about everything if you like walking. If not, there are a couple train stations about a 10-15 minute walk away. The staff was extremely helpful too! We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Dimitriladas
Reviews.Content: This was the best experience i ever had. The staff was really professional and friendly. The room had lots of light effects and i must say that the creator of the room has a lot of great imagination. When i entered the room it took me 10 minutes to realize i was not dreaming. I don't know about the other rooms but de "suite Sublime" made you really feel like you where in a fantasy. Even the bathroom was wonderful.... i can't say a negative word about this place really.. What i must say is that i recommend this place for young people, i can't imagine my parents in the suite sublime for example.(could be possible but a little strange i guess)This is only my personal opinion and i no way a negative point about the place. Its a young,fashion and glamourous place to stay. The only negative point maybe if you are with your car its a little hard to park, i would be great if the hotel had some parking space available for there costumers. You have to find a parking space in the streets nearby witch is not always easy (plus you have to pay) We where lucky it was weekend so it was free. But this is only a little detail no big deal. About the location i can't really express my self because we never stayed near the hotel and when we left we took the car or a taxi. Anyway i give this hotel a 9/10. It is a experience that i will never forget and i wish you the best of luck in the future. Thx

Reviews.Title: “Different experience... be aware of location”
Reviews.Author: player100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven for 3 nights in dec 2011. We wanted a different experience from the traditional hotels, and this place was recommended by a friend. Also we have a small, very lively... child and at some better traditional hotels, this is not always easy. First, the hotel service at reception and the bar is very kind, professional and helpful. The bartender is a pleasant american chap and we enjoyed hanging out there. i did not agree with all his cocktail mixes, but that was absolutely ok. We did not take breakfast here as we went to the French local bistros around. However, in light of the very positive reviews, it should be pointed out that this hotel caters to a very specific clientele (we are early thirties but felt a bit "old"). It is supposed to be hip, trendy and in a way it is. There is nothing really wrong with this. The reason we struggled were two-fold: 1. The rooms suffer from the typical French problem of size: Very small and dark, small windows. The lightening is somewhat cool, but the effects cannot unfold. It is all too cramped. You just cant move around, no storage space or anything. No table, nowhere to sit. Also there are no restaurant facilities and the area has charme, but is a bit rough and does not offer many good restaurants. 2. The biggest issue: The location is far away from the center of town and transportation is not that simple, takes a lot of time. It is located on the subway lines to comparatively rather problematic areas of Paris. The scene on these trains is very different from what you see in the traditional "better" central areas of Paris. Especially late in the evening female travellers should be aware. I had no issues, but my wife was not comfortable. In conclusion, unless you are looking for this grungy designer style cozy experience in an off-beat area, you get better value elsehwhere. If you are travelling with kids, this is simply not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel and services,but dreadfull bathroom”
Reviews.Author: bienM
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a ' levitation under the roof' room. Overall nice experience, good bedding, fairly good proportion of the room for paris. BUT'.. The bathroom was a big disappointment. This hotel is all about special lighting, but is is a problem: the bathroom is overall so dark that you can not manage to put on some mascara without poking your eye. There is not one decent light in ghe whole room. Every special light is beautiful from decorative perspective, but is a disaster from practical point of view.Besides, for 275 euro per night, one expect to be possible to take a bath or a nice, long hotshower...after a day of walking through Paris in the soaking cold rain. Instead of this, we found only a handheld shower, which only made it possible to take a short, cold ( no heating in the bathroom) rince with the little handheld stream. After this prehistoric activity, the whole bathroom floor was soaked, as well as a part of the carpet in the bedroom! I am sorry to write such negative review about this part. But is reflects my disappointment. Other then that, the staff, the services, the decoration of the hotel was very good and friendly and therefor I would recommend this hotel. But please, do not choose this type of room....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible. Its modern and funky, the rooms are amazing! Clean, unique, you can set your lighting from neon lights around the furniture to glittery stars all over the ceiling. This was a gem in the latin quarter of paris. Just outside the main hussle and bussle but walking distance to the centre or a tube nearby if you dont fancy the walk. As its just out of the tourist bit nearby restaurants are a bit less and you get a much more parisian feel, eating with the locals. The hotel has a bar, again ultra modern, great cocktails but quite pricey! Loved it. As a treat My husband organised a massage in the room which was wonderful. Really reccomend the spa services at this hotel too! Perfect relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Andreahansen
Reviews.Content: The room felt like being on the enterprise of star trek. It had the perfect balance of sexy and sleek European design without the high price. The hotel was just one street away from the metro so if you get a few days pass you can get anywhere in Paris within minutes. I stayed in the levitation room and that was more than enough for my fiancÃ© and myself. The hotel staff was very friendly and the bartender kept us drinking even after hours.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: CJ R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon and will definitely return! Very cool, modern and hip hotel just off the beaten path. There's a train station roughly 5 minutes walk away and a very cool street (Moufettard) a few blocks away filled with bistros, bars, restaurants and entertainment. Easy to access most places in the city via metro or foot. Great breakfast in the bar and downstairs, a little pricy, but good. Big showers for Paris and very comfortable beds. Very friendly staff who speak english well. You wont regret a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky and sexy”
Reviews.Author: KatiNM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a romantic weekend! The decor of the rooms is really different and fun. The location is good, near nice restaurants and bars and not in a too touristy area, but well connected with transport. Friendly and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Interior... Deceiving Location”
Reviews.Author: Spasinsky
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, my wife and I were impressed with this small but stylish hotel. The staff looks like they walked off the pages of Vogue and acts in the most professional manner! The price was great for a secure, fashionable, stylish Parisian boutique hotel. The front desk service was the friendliest we received in Paris. They are committed to the guest's experience, an unusual Parisian attitude. Evidence: After a small shower leak was discovered in our original room (a standard Levitation room, but a piece of art no less), that caused a damp odor, we were given a free upgrade to the Alice Suite. This is where this hotel shines. THE SUITES!! The Alice suite has a light show built into the walls like I have never seen before. Truly unique technology. Incredible decorations all eluding to Alice in Wonderland. A 3 foot rabbit looks like it is running through the wall. Portholes in the bathtub. I can go on forever. This room was the best I have ever stayed in... And I am Gold or Platinum at most of the big hotel chains. We read that it was designed by a famous hotel designer, and his attention to detail is amazing. Hats truly off to this truly Mad Hatter!! WE WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Levitation rooms small, dark & dingy, however suites are beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Sofiah78
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure how to rate this hotel as we initially booked a 'close to the stars' room. The room was extremely small and very dark. An electrician had to be called up to repair a flickering light and believe you me a flickering light in a dark room is enough to make you go insane. After expressing our concerns about the size and the light in the room, we were given the option to upgrade to suite at an additional cost of Â£185 on top of the Â£190 we had already paid (the manager only knocked off 20 euros and even that was after much haggling) for the night. Initially we were told that the only suite available was the 'Diamond suite', however when I complained about the light in the levitaion room miraculously the 'On/Off suite' became available which is a much brighter suite. The suite itself is stunning, airy, spacious and very unique. The average rating given is because the 'Levitation' rooms are a poor excuse for a room but the suites are amazing if you can afford the price. We paid in total Â£375 for one night in a suite for which the staff could have charged alot less seeing as though the room would have remained vacant anyway. Would I stay here again - No!, however if anyone out there is is celebrating a special occasion and money is not an issue then I would highly recommend booking a suite at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, dark, loud, and bad location. This hotel is the wrong choice”
Reviews.Author: aeresin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business trip mid September. The room had no place for a single luggage and no desk for my computer. The room was darkly lit, and received all the noise from the street below. The location is terrible.Middle of nowhere in the far south east of the city. I had a free day but couldn't organize myself properly because I was too far from all major attractions like Eiffel, Concord, Etoile, Champ Elysee. Even St Michel was a 25 min walking distance, the only main attraction which would be considered close enough. I do not believe most of the reviews. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing stay....we want to go back straight away!”
Reviews.Author: Em10Oxford
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased i chose this hotel for my husbands 30th birthday treat, it was amazing in every way! The hotel itself is modern, quirky and different. The hotel staff CANNOT do enough for you. On arrival we were welcomed by a lovely receptionist who offered us drinks straight away. As we had arrived early, we were told that check in wasnt until 4pm but she would call us as soon as our room was ready. Within a minute of sitting down for our drinks, we had been allocated a room early so we could get settled in straight away. We spent the day out in Paris and when we returned the same receptionist asked us how our day was. The rooms are amazing...modern, comfortable and has everything you could possibly need. Huge flat screen tv on the wall, coffee machine and ipod docking station. The other amazing thing about the room was the shower. It was hugely spacious (with a double shower hose for two people!) and one main shower above. The stars in the ceiling and shower were beautiful, we slept with them on through the night and it was so calming. The location is perfect too. A short 10 minute walk from the hotel to the RER station which connects you with Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower....easy and cheap to get to! On check out i handed the room key back to the receptionist and asked if i could pay for the breakfast as it was not included in our room rate, to which i was told that it was a gift from the hotel to us as it was my husbands birthday and that no payment was necessary. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel, worth every penny and would not think twice about staying again!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmiekie
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW!! This hotel is amazing....just everything about it was great. It was in a good location, not too far from the tube station....10 minutes walk away from the Pantheon. There were a few restaurants on the same road as the hotel. All the staff were good...in fact they were excellent. Room service was lovely, very well presented and it tasted lush!! Breakfast...mmmm mmm mmm :) All good. My diet went out the window as the crepes in the morning were just calling out to me. The best part about the hotel though was our room!! The bed was soo comfy that we just never wanted to get out of it. We were lucky enough to have booked massages....if you want to really relax then i suggest you book one. The are in room so its makes it even harder to leave the room after you have been completely pampered. We will be back again.....i am counting down the days already!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve the reception, cannot improve its location'”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is not ideal and the room's dark deco (levitation) made us feel a bit oppressed. The check-in at 16:00 is way too late for an early arrival in Paris and the check-out was painfully slow. Most staff we met spoke very limited English. The hotel lacks atmosphere and the bar/reception was deserted at all times and finally we ordered a taxi which came 15 minutes earlier than expected and with a 12 Euros bill upon arrival. We told reception that this wasn't acceptable and they simply replied that 'it was the french way'. We sent the taxi away in a very British fashion. Overall, it didn't leave a good impression on us so we probably wont return.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: debeliaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the seven hotel in Paris in June. The service was impeccable. The room and decorations from the ceiling to the floor was one of a kind. The Suite are out of this world .Every night there was turn down service with jazz music playing when I came in. The front desk and concierge just went above and beyond. Great experience! I will stay here everytime I come to Paris. Best Hotel In Paris Deborah :)

Reviews.Title: “A special place for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: vmar3
Reviews.Content: Located near les Jardins du Luxembourg, with a direct RER connection to CDG airport, the hotel is in a typical Paris building. Everything about it is special: the decoration, the lobby and, of course, the room. We got a 'levitation room' (rather small) with dark walls, a bed that seemed to be floating in the middle of the room with a purple light underneath, a flat-screen TV with seven 'olfactive' channels such as fireplace and marine breeze, stars on the ceiling, a Nespresso machine and a dual shower in a glass cube with LED lighting! What I liked the least was the wc, located in a separate cublicle really claustrophobic and small (but it could be regarded as a part of the room design...). All in all, a memorable experience that I definitely recommend for a special occasion (not for a long stay). True, it comes at a price, but if you think about it, hotel rooms in Paris tend to be expensive while smallish, worn and without character. This hotel may cost a bit more, but you get a lot more in return.

Reviews.Title: “An experience!”
Reviews.Author: marka063
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the greatest street in Paris to be honest and is just a little bit out of the way. We stopped in the floating bed / bath room, and it is a really clever design and concept, and have not seen anything like it before. The design and quality is fabulous, and there is a whole range of lighting and mood settings. The bed was ultra comfy and the shower / bath were great. Let's face it this is a place for a special occasion / dirty weekend. On that level it works. The bar / reception are fairly pointless and I certainly wouldn't bother with brekky as there are many characterful cafes that you can walk to instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Fayecurrie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing!! It's incredibly stylish with thoughtful design and quirky concepts, overall it's stunning.... But it doesnt end there, the staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful nothing is too much trouble from the maids to the receptionist to the bar staff they where fantastic! It was the icing on a splendid cake! Thank you for a lovely stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LauraM80
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this booking as i heard bad reports about hotels in Paris. But Seven Hotel was really everything i expected. the rooms were clean and hi tech and were exactly as portrayed on the web! for a hotel with a twist this is defo a cool place to stay! it's not entirely central in location but everything was a short cab ride away. although the room was small i would defo reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, overpriced, clueless”
Reviews.Author: Massimox84
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK. The hotel is nothing special, for the prices they have you'd expect it to be amazing. it's just not. Bad taste all over, friendly staff but lousy manager. Bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryllk
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised! The hotel is trendy & modern. The room was clean and the desk staff was friendly and helpful. It just if we were transferred in another world !!! Location was great , very close from St Germain and convenient to visit Paris. The price we paid was excellent, based upon location, accommodations, and the prices in the surrounding area. We were quite pleased and are likely to consider Stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Casablanca140906
Reviews.Content: Perfectly designed Hotel, helpful and charming staff, rooms wonderful with little space for clothes etc., bed is of real great quality, nearly everything is very convenient to people who like smaller hotels with atmosphere, design and a "little more".

Reviews.Title: “Totally funky room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Bos2nTraveler01
Reviews.Content: This was a 40th birthday gift - a nice way to end a 2.5 week birthday trip. Room was on top floor - spacious, very cool, a neat experience. Only issue was bathroom - a cool room but weird shower - just a hand-held wand so it made taking a shower an extra long and awkward experience. We soaked the entire bathroom with each shower. Water all over the place. And then no towel hooks so we had wet towels hanging all over the room. But otherwise a really cool place. Staff was super friendly, too, and spoke English fluently.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the World's Best Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeteCT
Reviews.Content: The SEVEN HOTEL is a beautiful oasis in the city of Paris. My wife and I traveled with our friends for my 40th Birthday in February 2011. Everyone loved the hotel. It was very clean and modern. This hotel is very unique. Perfect for couples or single travelers. The rooms were cozy but ample size. The shower was unbelievable. Hotel location is very quite with the walk nearest Metro station about 10 minutes. I would stay here again. However, I believe what separates this hotel from any other hotel that I have stayed in is the Superior customer service. The customer service began BEFORE we even arrived in Paris. We sent a few emails to the hotel asking questions and always received a prompt response. There were four of us traveling in Paris and no one spoke any French at all. The staff spoke perfect English, gave us directions and always greeted us with a smile. This made all the difference in the world because we all felt very comfortable. I can not say enough nice things about the entire staff, especially, Graciela. She helped our group immensely before we got to Paris and while we were in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic design and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Alaa76
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the hotel for 6 days, the hotel talks about itself from the previous positive reviews I've read and they were spot on. Hotel location is quite, it is less than 10 minutes walk to les gobelins Metro station. Hotel rooms' design are exotic, rooms are beyond contemporary and it's like a modern art gallery worth staying in. Last are the hotel staff whom contributed to the overall stay, they were full of enthusiasm and support and always carried a smile, they were simply great!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Lola418
Reviews.Content: This place is magic - cannot stress enough how friendly and welcoming the staff are, which makes such a difference. We had the room under the stars which was spacious, comfortable and very funky! Had a great view too. A perfect backdrop to a wonderful trip. Nothing needed to be changed but if I was to be really picky I'd say an extra white light around the bathroom mirror(for make up purposes) and the shower had to be held all the time, would rather have had a fitting for it above head height. We had a massage in our room on the morning of our anniversary which was divine, and also the breakfast was superb, second to none. Even the complimentary bathing products were beautiful - essential oil shower gels and l'Occitane soaps. I want to be back already! Thanks to everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “No idea why this place has such great reviews”
Reviews.Author: csimons1
Reviews.Content: Basing reviews on Trip Advisor and trusting my Jetsetter, I decided on this hotel for a paris stay with a girlfriend. I just was speechless at the size of the rooms being around 160 sq ft and the set up of the rooms. the cheesy fluorescent lights and decor in the room was like nothing i've seen. We upgraded from the smallest room to the second smallest room for a few extra square feet for a crazy amount extra...we just had to do it being that we were two girl friends traveling together that don't want to shower in front of each other while the other person is laying essentially next to them on a bed. We rigged up bed sheets to make it a little more intimate. there wasn't even a place to lay out both of our suitcases. you had to shimmie around the bed. aside from the shock and cheese of the room, we were very disappointed with the service or lack thereof. we called down to have ice and cream brought up in the morning and ice at night for water and wine etc...one morning two hours went by and we still hadn't received the ice or cream...we called back down and no one made mention of our initial request. house keeping took the bag we had bought to transport groceries and items around town and took one of our robes at one point.... the robes and the shower after we rigged up the bed sheets were about the only thing we liked about the hotel at all. the location was very quiet and really nothing for two single ladies to do so we ended up going to other areas during the day and at night. being that this hotel was on jet setter, I went for it right off the bat, but for guests who are used to the standard of jet setter, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “007 Suite is the coolest place in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Hotcup2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Hotel Paris at the end of our Honeymoon. We had booked a levitation bed room, but upon check-in we got upgraded to the 007 suite. Which after a long-day of train travel, was amazing. The lobby is small but really cool, they have 3d TV with the logo and bubbles. They really do appear to be coming towards you. That is super-cool. Now, let's get to the room. You walk in and to your right is the gold bathroom, it is as cool as it sounds. To your left is the main bathroom with 2 sinks and the coolest shower ever. It is a steam shower, rain shower and about 4 other types. It was amazing! The room is set-up to mimic the beginning of Bond films with the gun barrel and they nailed it. To the right is the large bed and to the left is the living room and the end of the barrel. The end of the barrel also hides the large HDTV that has every Bond movie available for viewing whenever you want. This was cool, as we were totally ready to chill. Note: this room looks just like the hotel's photos. Which almost never actually happens.

Reviews.Title: “The Unique Boutique in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my fiancÃ©e's bday. A splendid boutique hotel on the south side just a few stops from notre dame. A magical experience with super service and truly unique room designs. I thought I would be lost as I didn't charge my iPhone and left my charger at home but the room had an idock therefore problem solved. Highly recommended and a must if you want to experience something more than what the standard hotel chains offer.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest and kindest hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: lisa0220
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughetr in this funny, quirky very well designed hotel. If you like far out design that inspires and wakes your imagination, this is it. BEST of all is that the staff are the friendliest people, not that common in Paris. Any problem we had, they would solve over our expectations, with a kind word to that. Hot tip : If travelling with kids - go for the Alice Suite, live in Alice in Wonderland and play chess in the bathroom :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin760
Reviews.Content: Very nice and original place to stay. The rooms are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting hotel (small rooms, like all of Paris)”
Reviews.Author: Putney_resident
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a roamntic weekend and it certainly lived up to it. The room is small, though a decent size. We booked a room with a double walk-in shower which was awesome. The night-sky ceiling lights were also very fun. Breakfast is expensive (17 each) but the choice in the buffet is great (though not that good for bacon and eggs, if you're feeling like a fry-up) - maybe good if you're feeling tired one morning. Bar is also good, though usually quite empty. In a non-touristy area which I really liked and only a few stops on the RER overground from Gard du Nord which was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “LED lighting gone haywire”
Reviews.Author: rantati7
Reviews.Content: Even though in pictures the blue led lighting migh look cool - but in real life they've gone gone completely haywire . There's the blue lighting in the rooms, rooms doors change colour constantly (colour changing led's). There are places that have done the gimmich tastefully. Here it's just tacky. Location Hotel 7 is located in a rather lively part of Paris. Seven is however on a quiet side street in an old renovated building. This part of Paris is relatively poorly serviced by the MÃ©tro. The one of closest MÃ©tro stations in some 800 metres from the hotel. It's not far but in central Paris where you have a metro station in nearly every block this part of the city is not your ideal location if you want to use the public transportation (other than bus) to get around. Hotel From the outside hotel 7 looks promising. When you enter the lobby the tackiness hits you on the face. The lobby area is crammed with odd looking chairs, a plethora of different kinds of lamps, a 3D TV. There's a as well a small bar/cafÃ© on the ground floor. They've put a consirable amount of money on the decor - however, at least in my opinion, overdoing it so that it's become tacky. Room I was staying in a "levitation room". First when you enter the floor you have the room doors that look like they've been made out of plastic. The coluor changing lighting just adds to cheap look. Once you enter your room you are likely to blinded ... well.... the darkness of the room. Windows are cover bu heavy curtains that are closed even during day time. And once you find how to switch on the lights you are surrounded by the blue led lights: floor, walls, ceiling. The room is normal size in Parisian standards. Else where you might have a bathroom the same size as the whole room. Summary Definately not worh the price I paid: 247 eur per night. At 120 EUR hotel 7 could be ok. But with it's rather remote location and the tacky interior I do not think hotel 7 deserved to be as high up on the Tripadvisor list as it current is. I have seen hundred and hundred of hotels and unfortunately hotel 7 deserves a position below 100 of all the hotels I've been to. There can be cheap hotels that get my full points. Facturing in the price, location and the led lighting gone haywire - I would not stay here a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ravrudy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights at the end of a 2 week tour of Europe and what a treat! By far the best hotel we stayed at during our trip. Rooms are not big but make up for it in decor and atmosphere. The design and lighting was tremendous and really made us feel like we were someplace special. The bed was super comfortable, the TV was huge and the shower was the best part. The front desk is super friendly and helpful, they give you a grand tour of the hotel and personally walk you up to your room. They answered all our questions and gave us some great dinner recommendations. They held our bags after checkout for a few hours so we could go out before we had to leave town. Free internet is a huge plus. It's located on a quiet street in the Latin quarter pretty close to the pantheon and Notre Dame (about 10-15 min walk). Public transportation is close (metro is 5 mins away). Great restaurants only 5 mins away. Can't say enough good things about this place, we will definitely stay here again. If you're looking for a great Parisian get away and/or and romantic place to stay you can't do much better than the Seven. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Funky cool boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: beefoe
Reviews.Content: Second visit to the Seven Hotel and again very impressed. The rooms are small, but very funky and well appointed. The lighting is amazing with all sort of blue and green lights and LED lighthing in the ceiling that look like stars. The bed (in the Levitation rooms) is cantilevered off the wall so it seems to flow. Don't worry, it's completely solid. Despite the funkiness, the rooms are practical, have big flat panel TVs, and a very nice shower. Location is just OK since the street it is on is kind of quiet, but very close to a lot of attractions so for a lot of people that makes things better. Make sure you head down Rue de l'arbelete to (i think) Rhu Lhomond where there are dozens of very cool cafes and restuarants. The bar is small but cool like the rest of the hotel and the mixology drinks are great. I found the staff extremely friendly and eager to please, although sometimes thier eagerness did not necessarily end up in success.

Reviews.Title: “Unique design with matching service...”
Reviews.Author: JTGnyc
Reviews.Content: The Seven was clearly a change of pace as we have during many visits to Paris stayed in small yet traditional hotels on the Right Bank. What a huge serving of eye candy! Our room was stunning in its blues and glass. The bed was a genuine king and exquisitely comfortable. Very creative use of space and the staff was friendly, helpful and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!! What a unique and fun experience!”
Reviews.Author: Katluvs2jetset
Reviews.Content: I made the right choice booking this hotel for our quick but romantic trip to Paris! It was everything my husband and I were looking for and much more! The staff here is so helpful and super nice! We had some itinerary changes and they immediately took care of it! We worked mainly with Delphine during our stay and she really made sure we had a great experience! The hotel is a boutique hotel and very funky, cool and different! Upon checking in, we were told that our room that we originally booked was not available but that we would be upgraded for our first 2 nights to the Black Diamond Suite instead. First off, let me start by saying that the rooms and suites in European hotels are generally much smaller but seriously when you're away on a romantic trip, it really didn't matter one bit to us! It was one of the coolest and sexiest rooms we've ever stayed in. Swarovski crystals galore!! A girls dream room! Absolutely gorgeous and everything is top of the line and ultra modern! The entire hotel and all the rooms are this way. Chic, romantic, clean, AMAZING rooms, great service and great location! We had such a wonderful time in Paris and we were sad to leave. I would highly recommend this hotel to those that like a more Non-traditional experience and like boutique hotels like we do. It was truly memorable and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An Adventure”
Reviews.Author: worldcupwillie
Reviews.Content: A really, really cool hotel. In the Latin Quarter, about 15 minutes walk from Notre Dame, with plenty of excellent and well priced places to eat within easy distance. The walk will take more than 15 minutes if you stop at as many bars and cafes as we did though... The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, and you can tell that a great deal of thought has gone into it. The interior is visually stunning, beautifully lit, and there are a range of fantastic aromas in the public areas and the rooms. Bar is very funky - art on the wall for sale if you have 3,000 euros burning a hole in your pocket. Barman very helpful, cocktail making is an art. Bedroom - ours was the Levitation room. A really comfy bed, superb shower and an HD TV - make sure your French is up to scratch though as it is nearly all domestic channels. Lighting in the room is really cool, especially the storm cloud ceiling. We were really impressed by the quality of this hotel - they have thought through their whole proposition in great detail, and I don't doubt you could pay more for a less memorable experience. The staff were really friendly, in a polite and appropriately informal way which I liked. They tolerated my so-so French, helping out in English when I got stuck. Nous avons passe un tres bon sejour a l'Hotel Seven Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MegaMax
Reviews.Content: Ultra-modern quirky design, excellent service, exceptional breakfast, great attention to detail, top quality - though you do have to pay for it, and it may take a while to work out what all the light switches do! It's within walking distance of the Latin quarter. Smaller rooms (and they are small) are at the front, overlooking the street, but the windows are pretty sound-resistant, and the road isn't very busy. Larger rooms are at the back. Don't bring the kids - it would be wasted on them and it's not entirely child-friendly. And the lack of tables in the rooms (or at least in the smaller rooms) means the rooms aren't suitable for working in. It is, however, ideal for couples looking for a romantic break - but you might not want to leave the hotel to see Paris. Except, perhaps, to visit the patisserie around the corner...

Reviews.Title: “glamour beauty romance”
Reviews.Author: KarenRo
Reviews.Content: Three words to summarize our wonderful stay at Seven Hotel! We came from the United States with my husband to visit the beautiful French capital and savour the well-known French food and wine. Given our common passion for French history, we had chosen the Â« Marie-Antoinette Â» Suite on the Seven's website. We were shown directly to our room: it was just perfect! A flash-back to the Palace of Versailles. They had created a sophisticated atmosphere through an exceptional design: a wonderful canopy bed with bright-colored pillows, quotes pressed into the curtains, a great sofa for â€œfrivolityâ€� and swallows in the starry sky. In the bathroom, we loved the claw foot tub and shower. The large amenities at our disposal also show their permanent attention to detail: an IPod radio, a bottle of champagne, a Nespresso, free Wi-Fi... We highly recommend Seven Hotel to other couples for a memorable experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: hannahhattson
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hostel almost randomly, and we were not at all disappointed by this choice! First, the location is perfect, since we are in the heart of the "quartier latin" and very close to attractions such as the famous University "Sorbonne". But more importantly, the room was very romantic, with a modern design and the possibility to enlighten the ceiling with stars. Of course, the mattress was really comfortable, and the staff was full of consideration with us (for instance they offered us a bottle of french champagne, and the bed was covered with rose petals when we arrived). In a word, if you choose this hostel, you will leave it with fantatic memories and only one question: when is our next stay in the Seven Hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: SofiaGeo
Reviews.Content: A beautiful boutique hotel, clean with unique and fresh interior design....but what made the difference is the excellent customer service. At a capital city such as Paris that is not so known for their warm smiles, willingness to speak english and help tourists, Seven Hotel's staff where a breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mightycrumb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Seven Hotel over New Years Eve 10/11 and had a spectacular stay. The hotel is very modern but not cold and sterile; tastefully decorated with lots of clever details and fun design choices. Part of the appeal is the intimate size and situated on Rue Berthollet just off the beaten path, but very close to the bustling area of Notre Dame (10-15min walk). We stayed in the Levitation room. The room was small but perfect for a couple, not cramped. A romantic and sexy feel to the room, different lighting options, amazing shower! great coffee, large flatscreen TV. The levitating bed is very high off the ground but extremely comfortable, we almost wasted an entire day in Paris because we slept in until mid afternoon without waking up once. The service is fantastic, the reception is very helpful with recommendations, item requests are brought to the room quickly and with a smile, and the bar in the lobby has delicious cocktails and a very quiet yet hip vibe. A short (12 min) walk around the corner is a spectacular French restaurant called La Closerie des Lilas, if you're looking for a traditional french meal in a classy and historical atmosphere go here; Hemingway, Mick Jagger, Salvador Dali, amongst so many others have been patrons here. Overall we had a great stay at Seven and will definitely be coming back, next time we'll try and splurge on one of the more interesting suites, 007, On/Off etc... You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Stay"”
Reviews.Author: simon_s85
Reviews.Content: We booked the levitation room for the 31st to the 2nd of january. We arrived at the hotel and we were welcomed very friendly. At the check- in we were told that we can stay in the marie antoinette suite, what a wonderful surprise:-) When we entered the suite we were just absolutely fascinated about that room. The staff explained all to us and it was very clean, and the bed was huge ( we slept never so good in a Hotelroom), there was a big lounge with pillows, a minibar, a big flat- screen TV and a perfect bathroom. The ceiling hat small lights that looked like stars in the dark. We felt like the queen and the king in that room. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and answered our questions very fast and professional. These days at paris were one of the best we`ve ever had. Thank you again for this unforgettable holiday , we will be back soon.... simon and sarah.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel for a special stay”
Reviews.Author: RCCS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 days at Seven as part of her surprise birthday celebrations. Just fantastic -- very romantic - the room was very special. We would also recommend the bar for pre-dinner drinks and continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The coolest, funkiest, modern hotel in Paris, if not the world.”
Reviews.Author: NYCKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the on / off suite at Hotel Seven. Everyone I met was exceptionally nice and conversational. This made a positive impression on me because the staff went above and beyond to make the experience personalized - I got shown directly to my room, they explained the hotel features thoroughly, they asked me if I needed a cab etc, I've never had this level of genuine attentiveness at any other 4 or 5 star hotel. Just perfect. This consistent attention to detail is also shown in every inch of the hotel. The on / off suite is like something out of a dream, which incidentally is their motto! - beautiful all white Barcelona chairs, bedding with wrap around drapery, glass incased artistic displays with vintage French novels, miniature antiques and doodads, creative drawings and quotes etched on the glass. The detail and quality is just incredible. There is a bottle of Taittinger champagne in the room, along with a well stocked minibar of high quality products, an iPod radio, a large flatscreen TV, a safe, a big modern bathroom with a large bathtub and mood lighting, designer bath products and bathrobes, a soft quilted carpet, luxury high thread count sheets and the pillows and bed that will make you feel like you are floating on a cloud. It is heaven. The reception area, bar, hallways, entrance, hotel facade etc all display the hip, funky, modern and creative designs that this hotel is known for. Coming from New York and traveling worldwide for consulting work fairly regularly, I've had the chance to stay at similar hotels like the Standard in New York and St. Martins Lane in London. However, I must say Seven Hotel is redefining this niche market, and I sincerely believe that they offer a better value proposition for what you pay for. For example, you can get a designer suite with unrivaled creative detail at Seven Hotel for the same price you would pay for a very small room at St. Martins Lane in London. Excellent value for the price. I highly recommend Seven Hotel to other business travelers or other people that want a memorable funky, hip, modern hotel experience when they visit Paris. This is the only place I will stay at when I'm in Paris now. Take a look at my photos, and you will see why!

Reviews.Title: “A cool hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: VandBoys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 4 nights in this very cool and modern hotel. I loved the website and think if anything, the hotel was more impressive in the flesh. The best thing about the Seven is the location as you are well away from the hussle and bustle but within walking distance of it. Notre Dame is only 25 mins away and the Metro about 15 mins. Our favourite local area was Rue Mouffetard which is packed with market stalls, deli's, cafe's, bars restaurants and bistro's as well as lots of lovely little shops. The hotel is clean and stylish and the quality of the fittings, bedding etc was very good. I would say that for a four star though it is lacking a few little extras such as bath robes, film channels on tv (hey we were on holiday without kids for the first time in a very long time!) and good quality loo roll!!!! The was a total lack of any information about the hotel and it's facilities in the room, a little booklet would have been great. On the first night we got a fantastic restaurant recommendation and map from the Mexican lady on reception who was extremely helpful, we weren't so lucky the next night when we asked for help from other staff. e did also managed to get locked out in -2 degrees after a late night back from a club and there is no telephone number on the outside of the building......be warned! To be fair it was about 5.30am and someone did show up after about 20 mins of knocking! I would recommend this hotel as I think it's good value for money and has plenty of novelty appeal but think I personally have had enough of blue twinkly lights for now!

Reviews.Title: “Glamour and surprise”
Reviews.Author: Bob101101
Reviews.Content: We came for a night as part of my fiancÃ©es birthday celebrations and we were wowed by the levitation room. There were some elegant parts to the room but finding them was sometimes a challenge (how many light switches!?!). Great and helpful staff were on hand when needed. There is a design review of a room like we had here http://goo.gl/fb/iVRQE

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, interesting hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: marostar
Reviews.Content: Having chosen this hotel for its reviews on tripadvisor we were very happy when we arrived as everything was great. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 4.45 so we were given complimentary tea/coffee and a free back massage in the lounge area which was a bit quirky but nice all the same. The receptionist brought us to our room and she was very nice. The room itself was fab (small but fab). The room was exactly like the pictures on the seven site. It was a bit dark in the room as it was black but the lights on the ceiling were like twinkly starts. The room decor was very very modern and the shower and hand basins were all behind glass. The bed was great and comfortable. The location was great. Not too close to the centre, it took about fifteen minutes to get into the centre of Paris. The hotel is in a safe and nice area with lots of little cafes around. Our air conditioning seemed to be off even when it said it was on which made the room very hot at night time. Our towels were changed every day and the room was spotless. There was an espresso machine in the room, a huge white sony bravia HD TV which was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL FOR SPECIAL WEEKEND BREAK”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer1958
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for weekend break at the end of August.2010. On arrival in the afternoon we were made very welcome by the front desk staff Bruno & Colombe who also confirmed our pre booked dinner reservation via the internet through them for the restaurant La Cordonnerie. They also provided us with a map of the metro and directions for later that evening. As we were running slightly behind schedule we enquired with Bruno if it was possible to book a champagne river boat trip for early evening. Unfortunately the one we had seen advertised was fully booked. Nevertheless it was no problem for him to ring around and managed to book us on cruise for early Saturday evening instead and again provided us with info & directions to get us there swiftly. We were booked into the Absolute levitation room which was modern and looked amazing with all the special lighting effects. The power shower was fantastic and looked great behind the glass panels at the top of the bed (only one reservation regarding the shower the glass/ceramic floor laths could have had spacers fit to allow the water to drain better also be careful as they can become quite slippery). Apart from that the whole bathroom unit looked to be of very good quality. The bed was very comfortable and as it was raised up off the floor we could make use of the space to store our luggage as there was only an open style unit to hang clothes in, to keep the room looking minimalistic and airy. The bar area is very impressive visually with glass balls suspended from the ceiling and a 3D screen with bursting 7 logo bubbles. We had breakfast on the last morning - a very good selection of yogurts, fruits, cereals, croissants, pastries and breads. The Hotel is in a good location, if you take the road diagonally to the left of the hotel approximately 10 min walk to Rue Mouffetard where you will find a good selection of restaurants. Thanks to you and all your staff for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmmm....”
Reviews.Author: Adsandkev
Reviews.Content: Well, its dark to say the least in the corridors and in the rooms, even with the lights on! and our room had a damp smell to it, just a hint, but enough to know they have problems with the glass cubicles that the showers are in. The rooms are very small (but they all are in Paris), but the great thing about floating beds is that you can put all your luggage underneath as their would not be enough room otherwise. The room was very clean and i have to say was always ready when we came back in the afternoon. We had drinks in the bar and the bar is wonderful done and the staff in the hotel could not be more helpful. The style of the rooms is just not for me and 3 days is more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: brian_a_yates
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend for 3 nights at Seven. The room was excellent, very unique and made the trip special as we had never stayed anywhere like it before! The staff seemed a little inexperienced as they lost our luggae for about 30 mins. I also asked for a bottle opener and got told to go to the bar (which was hosting a busy private function) to see if they has one I could borrow! We we re offered a free cocktail when they found the luggage but I expected a little better. I would definitely go back as we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magic trip”
Reviews.Author: Saaremaalover
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and charming hostel in the towncenter of Paris. The first impression is: hostel quite sober seen from outside, but so mind-blowing when you get in! We slept in an sparkling bedroom with the bed in weightlessness... for more sensation to be in SEVENth heaven. The decoration is so amasing, so design and chic. Stars in the sky and on the walls, mirrors everywhere, soft colored lights, velvet and so on: the Seven enable people to be lost in a daydream. Very charming staff. To sum up, ihis is just PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: bblackonline
Reviews.Content: When you book a hotel you want a few simple things. A clean room, a good bed, helpful staff with some knowledge of the city. Most hotels dont come close to providing these very simple things. Hotel Seven is the exception. The staff is exactly what you dream about for a small boutique hotel. Phillipe and Graciella are super. Who ever owns this place, take care of them. I have stayed at 1000s of hotels. These people are outstanding. The rooms are cool and hip and sexy. The beds are some of the best I have slept on. We had the room that the shower was behind the bed. Way cool. The shower is to die for. This is hands down the best shower I have ever taken. The hotel is a bit out of the way of central paris, but it makes for a nice quite neighborhood, so noise is not a problem. Great place to stay. And the breakfast in the morning is fantastic, full American/European meal. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not "great", stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnb3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 1 year Anniversary trip in Paris. We spent 7 nights in the Black Diamond Suite in the Hotel Seven. We had a really enjoyable stay, and the staff (Love and Graciella) were so lovely. They both spoke great English. Our flite was cancelled en route to Paris, so we ended up checking in a day late. I did give the hotel 1 day notice, and they were able to refund 50% of that night's stay. I was disappointed it was not the entire nite stay, since they were not even at full capacity. However, I will not hold this against them. The hotel, especially this room was VERY Expensive. I beleive you can find something less expensive. Or book yourself a regular room here, as the suites are not worth it. Our room was dark. SO very dark.(ie; the black suite) It was trendy and cool for the first day, then it was plain annoying that we couldn't see a thing. Even in the shower it was hard to read the products. The bed was pretty comfortable and the shower head pressure was great. We very much enjoyed our stay here, but I think for the price it wasn't completely worth it. We were never told their was breakfast available in the hotel, I literally found out the day we were leaving. It's not visible (as its in the basement) but I really wish we had known from the start that they did serve breakfast. There was also a fire alarm at night, but we were never told what the issue was. The plus's: this is on a very quiet street with bakery, pharmacie and metro nearby. The bed is comfortable, and the shower pressure is great. If you are looking for a low key, quiet, friendly hotel , this is a great bet. The downside: is definitely the cleaning staff (she arrived after 4pm each day) and after 5 days straight of asking for more handsoap, I gave up. She never did bring it, and never refreshed our other toiletries the entire time. We also very rarely got coffee refreshed in the room. I also really don't beleive she changed the sheets. We had trouble communicating with her. As a former hotel burglary victim. I was probably most upset that the safe is NOT nailed to anything. You can literally just walk out with it. But the front desk did hold onto our valuables in their own safe . The staff tries very hard, and I feel like this hotel has major potential, they just need to get it more 'together' . Perhaps offer more bang for your buck as well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MonaMona30
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Barcelona at 15:30 and though the check-in time at this hotel is 16:00 and we requested early check-in (only 30 min), they said the room is not ready and guess what the room was ready at 17:30! When we got to the room I had to ask them to change the sheets since there was a yellow stain on the pillow and hair on the sheets. The room is so small that we had to keep our cloths in our luggage ( we got the absolute levitation room). and when you stay in a 4 star hotel you expect to have a minibar in the room (as they claim they have in their website), but there was non! When our friends and family called the reception didn't care to give us their messages and this happened at least 5 times everyday. There was always a layer of dust everywhere and the security is just awful. On the day we were checking out since we had a late flight we asked for late checkout, the girl at the reception said she had to talk to her supervisor and get back to us , she never did, so I had to check with her again and she let me know that her supervisor said we could late checkout only if we paid 200 euros. The least this supervisor could do was getting out of her/his room and at least talk to us! Over all this hotel is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: sunshinenow66
Reviews.Content: Lovely new hotel, great style and fun, different to the big chains. Very expensive, though Paris tends to be so. If you fancy a change this is a great hotel. Staff excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Magic night!!”
Reviews.Author: Funkygirl_10
Reviews.Content: To sum up our impressions with my husband: what a magic experience in this lovely hotel!! The Seven leaves a feeling quiet and restful. In the bedroom, the starlight goes perfectly together with the sparkling lights on the walls: which creates a soothing atmosphere... Bedding very comfortable for some romantic moments in privacy. And the glass-fronted bathroom is so splendid. Even the service is beyond expectation: we got a wonderful French breakfast in the bed. Therefore we advice you to spend 1 night (or more) at the Seven!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome French hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueS0961
Reviews.Content: A very trendy, chic hotel in the Latin Quarter. Very nice for business, couples, singles, but not a family hotel. I would not bring children here. The service was great; the employees spoke English and were extremely helpful and attentive. A bit pricey, but worth the cost in my opinion. A full breakfast is available for an additional cost (17 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: COK64
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this hotel and loved it. It is very new and is still being fine-tuned, but in a most unobtrusive way which didnâ€™t interfere with oneâ€™s enjoyment. The room was small but extremely interesting with a wonderful big shower and very comfortable bed. Everything one could require was in the room, including a wonderful Nespresso machine. Itâ€™s a short walk to the metro, and there are a large number of places to eat nearby. The staff were exceptional, especially the Manager, who was a delight. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service, disorganized”
Reviews.Author: parisparis123
Reviews.Content: With the hundreds of hotels in Paris, this hotel is definitely not worth staying at. In terms of price, it is extremely expensive for the mediocre service, and average rooms.The hallways are completely black, carpet and walls, and everything is so narrow and small (including the rooms) that it feels like entering a cave and not a relaxing vacation. The rooms are not cleaned on time. We waited until 4pm and our rooms were still not cleaned. There's layer of dust on everything, the security box is not bolted to anything so anyone can walk out of the hotel with it. The hotel is disorganized with reservations, messing up and adding days to reservations. The lobby is full of cardboard boxes and delivery which make it a pain in the already small and suffocating lobby. It seems that the hotel ran out of money and had to open in a haste, work is still being done and the staff is neither organized (despite being numerous and equipped with walkie talkies) nor competent. Twice they made us wait for our room to check in, telling us it would only be 15 minutes. 45 minutes later it still wasn't ready because the maid was "dusting" (then we discover a layer of dust on everything, so not sure what they were actually doing). They sell themselves as a boutique hotel, but it's neither classy, nor run with class.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking & Freindly!”
Reviews.Author: Matt-Matty
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Friday where we were greeted by a very charming receptionist, who went out of her way to make sure we had the first available room, and aloud us to check in several hours early. The room was amazing, had a minor problem with the in-room safe, but they did everything to make sure that this was corrected immediately, and made sure our documents etc were safe in the mean time.... this is understandable considering the hotel was BRAND... and I do mean Brand New.... all state of the art! and very impressive. As once mentioned before, a minor design floor with the shower base, as with all three shower heads being on at the same time, it quickly over flowed the seal and started to flood the bathroom floor.... I adjusted the spacing on the panels in the shower base to be wider near the door so that it no longer flooded. Though they might consider changing the base slightly, or at least modifying it to avoid this problem. Other than this everything was fantastic, and I do mean everything! The staff were all very friendly, helpful & polite! It's in a good location depending on what you want from Paris, close to metro also. We did not meet the manager until the day of our departure as he had been on holiday, baring this in mind the other staff/managers did a great job. He was once again a very friendly charming chap, making sure that we had a lovely time and were well looked after, which we were. Fantastic hotel & great staff! We would love to return in the future, and recommend to friends! One final thing for anyone considering visiting this hotel... despite previous reviews, all building works pretty much seem to have come to an end. A gentlemen was finishing the entrance effects & painting during our stay, which was not a problem at all. I heard one hammer during our stay, which was on a Monday morning.... it was not an issue! Thanks Seven hotel & to all the staff... P.S I did propose, and she said yes :)

Reviews.Title: “the greatest hotel we've ever been”
Reviews.Author: ciulika
Reviews.Content: if you go to paris you should definitely go to Seven hotel.i know it sounds like a big commercial, but it's not! after we left from vernet hotel, an expensive and unworthy hotel on champs elysees, we found this one on the internet, and we were shocked by seven when we saw the basic room, imagine the suites, or the others.the levitating bed was more than i could ever imagine, i slept like a baby in this bed, very soft and big.the bathroom was minimalist, very clean and practical, our towels were changed every day, and the ceiling with the stars were charming at night, when, after a full day of visiting you came to sleep and recharge your battery.the coffeemaker was very helpful especially in the morning when we got ready for a long walk day.i was surprised to have an iphone charger in the room with radio that could complete the wonderful atmosphere with the stars on the ceiling and everything.the carpet was very soft and you felt like you dive in a whole different world as you entered the room.the street was very quiet and you could easily got to the hotel from the metro station les gobelins. All in all, the photos aren't so relevant because you have to live the seven experience to really understand what kind of vibe this hotel offers. i recommand it to everyone that goes to paris, and i'd like that it would be a hotel like this in evey city in this world so i could go and stay there.it was an unic experience that completed the charming Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel for a wonderful night with partner”
Reviews.Author: JorickNL
Reviews.Content: Room: My girlfriend and I stayed in the room named La LÃ©vitation. We were more than positively surprised by the magic of the room. The many light switches and the ipod docking station allow you to create the perfect atmosphere. The shower cabin has 3 showers of which the biggest one shines with neon light. This gives a wonderful effect! Food & drinks: We had 2 cocktails delivered up to our room and they tasted fabulous. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. There was enough choice of good quality food and the room itself was very trendy. Location: The hotel is based in a lovely area of Paris not far from some of the very well known touristic places. It makes the hotel a perfect starting point. Experienced downsides: * the booking description said "Public parking is possible at a location nearby". This is indeed very true as it's only a 5 min walk. What it didn't say is that the parking is very hard to find. Even with a printed map - given by the friendly hotel reception employee - it took us quite some time to find the parking. (Parking costs are at 3.90 EUR/hour but have a max of approx 25.50 EUR/day (which I consider to be very cheap for a big city)) * the room smelled a bit funny (damp) * the nespresso machine hadn't been cleaned and had an old coffee cup stuck in the cup holder * the room was quite small which makes it less ideal for longer stays Conclusion: The hotel is so different and spectaculair compared to other hotels that you easily will forgive and forget any of the downsides. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to have a romantic night in a trendy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - fantastic hotel, amazing room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mills9321
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing short of just plain amazing. The room was fantastic, I haven't seen anything quite like it. On top of the brilliant room there were some great extras, espresso machine, ipod dock and I loved the many different options for lighting and even smell of the room. The location was great, 10 minute walk and you would be standing next to Notre Dame. The staff in the hotel were lovely, we arrived early and were able to check in, on the day of departure we were able to safely leave our bags until later that day. They always made you feel welcome and answered any questions we had with ease. The hotel is costly but I have no regrets about paying for such a brilliant room. The room was a nice size and didn't feel too small. If you are looking for a place to stay that will make your weekend in Paris that little bit more special then this is the place. A previous review mentions payment problems and other misc problems, I didn't experience any problems, check out was painless and I had a great nights sleep during both nights.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and nice friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: valentine77
Reviews.Content: we only stayed one night in the absulute levetation room, was a great design but had problems with the shower as it over flooded onto the carpet. we told the manager and he was very nice and gave us a free upgrade to the room with the bath which was even better!! i would recommend this hotel very highly and can't wait to stay there again. xx

Reviews.Title: “dreadful stay which spoiled our holiday - poor security, 3 emergency fire alarms, overcharged by 850 euro”
Reviews.Author: cassandra-complex999
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven is not ready to open yet, not just because it is not finished, but for a myriad of operational problems you would not put up with in a hostel, let alone a Â£200 a night hotel. When I go on holiday I expect myself and my children to feel safe and my belongings to be safe in my room. I expect the hotel staff to understand what to do when there is an emergency fire alarm and to be able to pay my bill efficiently. These are minimum requirements.....I booked this hotel as the rooms looked amazing and we wanted somewhere really special and memorable for our once in a life time family trip to Paris. We left feeling exhausted, disappointed and sad , here's why. 1. fire alarm went off 3 times we were in the hotel. First time we were terrified and evacuated down the emergency fire escape which has very narrow treads. I cut the backs of my heels and my elder son nearly fell. We arrived in the lobby with the other guests and the staff were dealing with a checkout and ignored all the people standing around in various states of undress. We asked what was happening and they continued to ignore us until I started SHOUTING! They then told us it was " a test. I told them that if it was a test, they needed to explain that to guests before hand and not have them crashing down stairs in their pyjamas. Very poor. I told them that the next time an alarm went off now nobody would take the alarm seriously! My husband went to find out what happened later only to be told that it was not a test, but someone's hairdryer setting the smoke alarm off. The second time was during the day with someone smoking in the room. The third time was at 12.50 am. We were all asleep and my husband called to check with reception what we should do. We all came downstairs, in pyjamas again some people in towels only to be told that it was a false alarm in someone's room due to smoking. We asked who it was and were told that they were still in their room - great we said, why do they get to stay in their rooms when we all have to evacuate? By the time I got to sleep it was 2.30 am and I woke up again it 5.30 worrying about the bill - see payment point later - so 3 hours sleep had. 2. room keys didn't work - we had massive problems with our room key every day we returned - we would traipse up stairs only to find our key didn't work and have to go all they way back to reception to have them revalidated 3. security - we had a lap top, a Wii, a set of golf clubs, a portable DVD player and 4 suitcases with us - we returned one day to find our sons' room door completely open - the air con engineers had been in to fix it, but no one had bothered to lock the door again! luckily none of our possessions were missing. 4. security - room safe was not bolted down and could be tucked under your arm and walked off with . . . . 5.aircon - worked intermittently - sometimes freezing, sometimes not at all. When reported to staff, were told there was nothing they could do about it ..hello are they marketing themselves as a 4 star hotel or what? 6. Payment problems - this was quite shocking. There is only one payment point in the hotel in reception which is very small and queues would form. I decided to pay the night before we left, as we had tickets for Versailles early the next day and needed a speedy getaway - Payment wouldn't go through and I was told quite rudely that "there was a problem with my card" . I called my bank First Direct, who told me that they were not even receiving a request for payment to decline and that there was a problem with the terminal in the hotel. I told them this but they denied that it was a problem from their end and didn't check their equipment. We were left worrying how we would pay the bill as we couldn't take out Â£1000 in cash in time. Next morning, same problem - I explained what the bank had said, they called First Direct and had them tell them the same thing - check your terminal - we tried 4 other cards, my husbands debit and credit cards too - nothing worked. Eventually they agreed to call and report their terminal - this was now 8 oclock - and we needed to go. Eventually they put the payment through verbally, but when I checked with First Direct, payment had been requested twice. Note: (I had asked for a discount on the last night as I had only had 3 hours sleep due to fire alarm etc - 50% off both rooms). My bank explained that one had debited but the other was "pending" meaning we couldn't draw against that amount - Â£850 !!!. I explained that they needed to call and cancel the other request for payment, which they did, but the amount remained "pending " for a further week. Horrendous as we had a further 10 days in France. 7.Breakfast was great first day, other days, no pain o choclat or apple pastries, no OJ - nothing extra brought even though it was 9 am and breakfast didn't stop until 11 am. 8. good things - beds are very comfortable and showers great - very trendy interior which was already showing signs of wear and tear after a month. 9. electrical sockets in bed heads came out of their housing when you pulled your plugs out. 10. no english speaking TV of any description - hello 4 star?? 11. local area - street run down with boarded up shops and derelict restaurants 12. staff are young and very sweet but are struggling with day to day operational problems of monumental proportions. My advice to hotel seven?close temporarily and sort yourselves out - you are damaging your reputation and repeat custom by such poor service. My advice to other potential guests, don't bother - great marketing and beds that's all. My advice to Hot

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: FifiBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Le Seven as a surprise for my friend's birthday was amazing and very memorable. The hotel was superb. Although not yet finished ( can't wait to see it when it is) we were not disturbed in any way by builders or workmen, in fact it was very peaceful, rooms were quiet and tranquil, and we were at the front of the hotel, no traffic noise either. We had a 'standard' ( I'd call it plush) ) Levitation room and it was amazing, glass, double, powerful shower (bliss) with lights that changed colour, the comfiest 'levitating' bed in the world, soft linen, and fantastic air conditioning. It was particularly hot and sticky in Paris when we visited and so lovely to return to a cool room. We were mesmerised by the twinkly lights on the painted ceiling, very relaxing. The lighting effects in the rooms were amazing, very different to the norm.The reviewer who said you wouldn't want to leave your room was right, they are fantastic. And a bonus of an espresso machine in the room too, a rare occurence in Europe! I cannot recommend this hotel and it's wonderful staff enough, nothing was too much trouble for them, they were very helpful and welcoming and I wish them every success. If you get the chance, go and see for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

HotelInfo.Name: Seven Hotel Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 20 rue Berthollet, 75005 Paris, France
